metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21123 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incomplete cleanup of multi-core shared buffers for some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. It was discovered that some Intel processors did not completely perform cleanup actions on multi-core shared buffers. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-190-generic - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-3.13.0-190-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-3.13.0-190-lowlatency - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-190-generic - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-190-lowlatency - 3.13.0-190.241
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1109-aws - 4.4.0-1109.115
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1145-azure - 4.15.0-1145.160~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-3.13.0-190-generic - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-3.13.0-190-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-3.13.0-190-lowlatency - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-190-generic - 3.13.0-190.241
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-190-lowlatency - 3.13.0-190.241
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: intel-microcode: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'early microcode loading not allowed').
linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-190.241').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.115').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1145.160~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1').
linux-signed package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-190.241').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1145.160~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1').
